title: Ticket #5129: DCMsg unnecessarily reports failure
description:
When a DCMsg is cancelled, it can be set to suppress any failure messages.

It used to do this by setting a variable to 0. This apparently was the "/dev/null" log level (at least according to the docs). However, after the 8.1.x revamp of dprintf, 0 now implies D_ALWAYS.

We should re-suppress these messages. It results in many noisy "message cancellation" lines when CCB is heavily used.
remarks:
2015-Jul-02 07:57:23 by bbockelm:
This suppresses an obscure log message in a corner case. Not worthy of version history.
check_ins: 2015-Jul-02 07:56   Check-in [45199]: Suppress unnecessary cancellation message. #5129 (By Brian Bockelman )
